text: The Pond Creek Masonic Lodge #125 is a National Register of Historic Places- listed building in Pond Creek, Grant County, Oklahoma. According to its NRHP listing, it is an exceptional example of modern architecture in a town whose architecture is otherwise traditional."National Register Properties in Oklahoma: Pond Creek Masonic Lodge #125. Built in 1953, the architect was Dow Gumerson,National Register of Historic Places Registration Form for Pond Creek Masonic Lodge #125. who also designed the 1959 federal courthouse for the United States District Court for the Western District of Oklahoma in Oklahoma City.Barbara Snow Gilbert, "An Architectural Icon: The Oklahoma Western District’s Federal Courthouse" , Oklahoma Bar Journal, vol. 78, no. 2 (January 13, 2007), pp. 151-158. ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Grant County, Oklahoma Category:Clubhouses on the National Register of Historic Places in Oklahoma Category:Masonic buildings in Oklahoma Category:National Register of Historic Places in Grant County, Oklahoma
title: Pond Creek Masonic Lodge No. 125
